intro: Colymbada scabiosa, commonly known as the spiked speedwell, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has a creeping habit with hairy stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem. Colymbada scabiosa is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in sunny to partially shaded conditions.
